file_content.text: Lady Katei of the Panteers is waiting for you.
I've received word from Katei Panteer, the heir to the house. She'd like to meet with you.
House Panteer's current location is well guarded and not common knowledge, but the brass is granting you temporary clearance to visit.
Is this just a friendly "thank you," or is she looking for something more?
What does she want?
I think she hopes you're the heroes Alderaan needs to get that tyrant Ulgo off the throne.
I think she hopes you're the hero Alderaan's been waiting for to get that traitor Ulgo off the throne.
I'm honored.
Thank you.
The Panteers owe us... you... their lives now. It's crucial this goodwill lasts long enough to get a Republic government on the throne.
I've got better things to do than hold court with some spoiled princess.
Forget it.
Consider it part of the job. The Panteers have requested all of you, and it's crucial to the Republic that we keep their goodwill.
If I may be so bold, Master Jedi... I'd remind you that the Panteers' goodwill is crucial to putting a friendly government on the throne.
That wasn't a request, Sergeant. You're expected at the Panteer refuge and that's where the Republic needs you.
Just think of the reward waiting for you.
Still sucking up, even after they turned their backs on the Republic in its darkest hour--
Politicians are like planets. They orbit around whatever glows the brightest. But that's the game here, and if we don't learn to win it, the Empire will.
Thank you for your service.
Thank you for taking on those strike teams. I think that's the last of them.
There aren't many who'd take on such a dangerous mission on short notice. The Republic owes you.
But not half as much as House Panteer.
Has Bouris Ulgo called off his attack?
Are they safe?
The attack is off, for now, but no one on Alderaan is safe while Bouris Ulgo holds the throne.
How much are we talking?
Owes?
I was speaking metaphorically, but I'm sure House Panteer will put a figure to it.
There's nothing I can't do.
The reports said the strike was imminent. Go quickly.
Why help the Panteers? They left! The minute the Republic disagreed with them, they up and seceded.
The Panteers ruled Alderaan for the past century. If they're still alive, no one takes the throne without their blessing.
Ah. I was hoping you'd make your way here. Major Cressen told me of your actions at the bridge.
Ah. I was hoping you'd come. Commander Keikana spoke highly of your role in defeating the Killiks.
Ah, I was hoping to see you here. Duke Organa has said you prove the strength of the Republic's regard for House Organa.
Ah, you could not have come at a better time. I've heard about your deeds here. Most impressive.
How long were you listening? Are you aware of the situation with House Panteer?
Former ruling family, we need their support. Anything new?
I've got the basics.
Assume I don't know anything.
House Panteer?
Give me the briefing.
Alderaan's rulers have come from House Panteer for generations.
After the last Panteer queen's death, Bouris Ulgo invaded, slaughtered the entire bloodline. Until a few days ago, we believed he'd wiped them out.
However, we have new intelligence that some of the Panteer survived and are in the mountains.
So, that's good news, right?
That's great.
Except that Bouris Ulgo knows it too, and he's massing strike teams to finish what he started.
Does this threaten our plans on Alderaan?
But we're with the Organas....
Does this threaten your plans on Alderaan?
But you're with the Organas....
The Panteers served the Galactic Senate for centuries. Our concern is for their safety. Bouris Ulgo is currently massing strike teams to finish what he started.
Skip the history.
Bouris Ulgo knows this too, and he's massing strike teams to destroy what's left of House Panteer.
And the Republic wants us to risk our lives to stop them!
The Republic must stand against genocide, Captain Scov.
But the troops I sent never returned. And our reinforcements won't be here in time.
Let's see how these strike teams like fighting Jedi instead of defenseless nobles.
I'll stop them.
I suspect they won't have long to make up their minds.
The Force cries out at so many deaths.
We must prevent this massacre.
Jedi are legendary for their compassion.
Consider me your reinforcements.
I'll stop them.
I've got a weakness for imperiled noble families. So much treasure and so few people to share it.
I can probably help.
If the Panteers survive, I'm certain they'll see you well-rewarded.
What do I get?
The Panteers could buy and sell most of the Outer Rim. You'd be well-rewarded.
The Ulgos will be staging their move into the mountains for the assault by thranta. To track down the strike teams, look for their transports.
Good luck.
Don't look here. I've got no obligation to these Panteers.
Uh-uh. Not me. [Refuse quest]
It will be a harsh blow to the freedom of the galaxy should the Empire triumph here.
Ask anyone--the Republic's fate on Alderaan is tied up with the Panteers.
If you change your mind, come back. You could make all the difference in this battle.
Alderaan is a core world of the Republic. We cannot lose it.
We're honored to have you, Sergeant.
